Hey! What do folks think about making the “Subscribe to more streams” link in the bottom left not sticky?

If you have a small number of subscribed streams (as new users generally do), you would still see it. And if you are subscribed to lots of streams already, you probably aren't adding new streams very often at that point. If you do need to subscribe to another stream and don't think to scroll down, the "+" next to the STREAMS heading will do the job as well.

CC @Vlad Korobov , who proposed the idea. :)
I'm not certain the link is needed at all. it's kinda redundant.
I think of it as being primarily helpful for new users. I don't know if @Tim Abbott has any back story on when/why it was added?

Over time we've had a ton of complaints from folks who had trouble figuring out how to subscribe to more streams. The current design of the area next to the STREAMS label is better than the past moment when we added it (I think mainly the + icon is bigger).

I will note that making the element non-sticky could make it substantially harder to notice for anyone joining a large organization that has 20+ default streams. I think this is a pretty important/common situation -- most of our large open communities have a lot of streams.

One detail that may be relevant to understand is that some chat products, most relevantly Discord, don't really have a way to subscribe to a subset of the channels you have access to on a server. As a result, your left sidebar when you join a Discord server has all the channels you can ever access without someone increasing your permissions. I do think it's important to in some way convey that Zulip's left sidebar is not "everything in the server", just "what you are subscribed to", because some large portion of new users will assume incorrectly the wrong answer.

Tim Abbott said:

Over time we've had a ton of complaints from folks who had trouble figuring out how to subscribe to more streams. The current design of the area next to the STREAMS label is better than the past moment when we added it (I think mainly the + icon is bigger).

It was previously a gear rather than a +: #18694

It is possible that the improved + widget we have today, perhaps combined with adjusting the position of the filter icon, could be good enough that we don't need an additional advertisement for adding more streams, or it could be OK to just have it be non-sticky at the bottom (and importantly, appear when you use the filter widget to search for streams).

Alya Abbott said:

It was previously a gear rather than a +: #18694

It's gone through many iterations; I think it was just a smaller + at one point 2-3 years ago, and there was also a phase with a gear next to a +.

Each of those previous models had its own issues seen in usability study type settings -- either users who thought the + was just for creating new streams or users who thought it was just for subscribing to new streams. (And in each case couldn't figure out how to do the other thing).
(And I guess by "usability study settings" I think in this case I mean situation like chatting with someone at some in person event back when those existed).

Tim Abbott said:

I will note that making the element non-sticky could make it substantially harder to notice for anyone joining a large organization that has 20+ default streams. I think this is a pretty important/common situation -- most of our large open communities have a lot of streams.

In my limited experience, even if there's a large number of streams/public streams, the number of default streams tends to be just a few. (I suppose we could look into the actual data for this.)
My vote is for non-sticky, but it’s pretty speculative for me, since in my own user experience I got trained pretty early to go through our main gear menu.

I've definitely seen a few large public organizations, like PyCon India, that had 100+ default streams. So we should definitely be thoughtful about the design patterns for that.

I think even chat.zulip.org is pretty close to having enough default streams that one might have the perception that the left sidebar is 100% of streams that exist.

One of the challenges with non-sticky, BTW, is that we have various classes of low-activity streams that we sort towards the bottom in the left sidebar, and you'd need to scroll past all of those to see it. But I think if the idea is this button is a duplicate to the "+" button, it's probably OK if it can be lost in some organizations? Not sure.
Yeah, that's the thought. I'll file an issue for it, and I'm happy to do some new user testing before we deploy it to everyone. We're about due for a round of new user testing anyhow.

Thinking about the "Subscribe to more streams" link, Tim Abbott suggested that it might be nice to have that link provide useful information. So, it could say something like, "And N more streams" (or some other wording), where N is the number of streams you are not subscribed to that you can see in the organization.

If you are already subscribed to all the streams, we could show a "Create new stream" link, or nothing if you don't have permissions to create a stream.

Thoughts?

(If we decide to go in this direction, I will file a separate follow-up issue.)
I think "Browser N more streams" is the framing I'd have -- since you're not going to want to subscribe to them all probably.
I think this would really improve the experience when joining as a new user in a large community like Rust or this one that might have 15 default streams and another 30 that you are open to join.
Since you'd get a hint right on the main screen that more streams exist.
(We have all the data to compute the number and live update it)

Tim Abbott said:

Since you'd get a hint right on the main screen that more streams exist.

Tim Abbott , then would you still like to have "Subscribe to more streams" link as non-sticky?

As if we want to display this information to user that ->{More streams do exists} through "Browse N more streams", then shouldn't the link be sticky at the bottom of left-sidebar so that user is able to see it always!

Thoughts?
One thought here, although it might add more complexity than we want: it could be sticky until the user has subscribed to more than N non-default streams (where N is two or three, probably).

Yeah, that sounds a bit too complicated to me.

I don't think the link needs to be sticky, for the same reasons that we wanted to make it not sticky in the first place.
Yeah, agreed there's no need for it to be sticky.
umm, do we have any plans for changing the text of this "Subscription to more streams" link ? and add the logic part to it ? Tim Abbott Alya Abbott

Tim Abbott said:

I think this would really improve the experience when joining as a new user in a large community like Rust or this one that might have 15 default streams and another 30 that you are open to join.

(And we should probably arrange that the bottom whitespace is on that container, not the "Subscribe to more streams" element, so that something reasonably happens with avoiding the browser's URL display overlapping with content if it's not there).
Sure Alya Abbott , i'll do a PR introducing this asap. (Keeping in mind Tim's suggestions also).
